alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Douglas; Lac Qui Parle; Pope; Stevens; Swift; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 11:55PM CST until February 23 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...WINTER STORM ENDS BUT HAZARDOUS WIND CHILLS CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... .The accumulating snow has ended, but areas of drifting snow will continue overnight. Another round of Arctic air will settle in behind the storm system overnight. Wind chills of 25 to 35 below zero are forecast through Wednesday morning. The coldest readings will be over western Minnesota where the winds will remain stronger. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. Some patchy blowing snow is also possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Minnesota. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
